meanings.definition: Cause extreme physical or mental pain to
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was wracking my head with pain.
meanings.sent2: The dentist's drill wracking my tooth was unbearable.
meanings.sent3: I find it wrackingly funny how loud my cat snores.
meanings.sent4: The memories of war wrack his mind like a relentless storm.
meanings.sent5: The image of the car crash was so wracking, it stayed with me for days.

meanings.definition: Subject to extreme stress or anxiety
meanings.sent1: The wracking thought of failing the test kept her up at night.
meanings.sent2: The wracking feeling of anticipation before the big game was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: It's wrackingly amusing how my dog gets anxious during thunderstorms.
meanings.sent4: The wracking pressure at work felt like a heavy weight on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The wracking fear of heights made her freeze at the edge of the cliff.
